title: Bug 13725 - Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Revert operation in the java editor is slower compared to closing and reopening the file.
OB: The time taken to perform the Revert operation is longer than closing and reopening the file.
EB: This seems unusual because reverting the file contents should not take more time than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1) Open an editor on the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open-source repository.
2) Select the end of the first line and add a space character to mark the file as dirty.
3) On my (fast) machine at home, it takes about 8 seconds to perform the following steps:
   a) Click on the close box in the editor tab.
   b) Choose 'No' in the 'Do you want to save changes' dialog.
   c) Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
4) However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
